results.title: Performance appraisal
results.creator_credit: Don Sykes, Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Management by objectives and performance appraisal”.
An industrial education film which uses animation to review all the steps for successful and beneficial performance appraisal, including the gathering of facts, discussion of concrete, measurable objectives, and actual performance, and development of future work goals an plans. With leader’s guide.

results.title: Developing objectives
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow, Kaiser Aluminium and Chemical Corporation and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Management by objectives and performance appraisal”.
An industrial training film which uses animation to show employees methods of writing and developing work objectives which are understandable, measurable, challenging, achievable, and with a target dagte for completion.

results.title: What is MBO?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Management by objectives and performance appraisal”.
Management by Objective starts with an objective agreed to by supervisors and subordinates, with time limits. Concentrates on result, measurable and achievable The key is two way communication after manager identifies basic purposes of the unit and evaluation after the objective has been reached. Consists of cartoon drawings but is not animated.

results.title: The Future of alternative technology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Made Futures, Design and Technology”.
Defines “alternative” energy and technology and discusses the viability of this technology in technical and economic terms. Raises questions of whether alternative technology can be a major contributor in the production and consumption of energy.

results.title: Man in the Making
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Dr. J.M. Tanner, Reader in Growth and development in children at London University introduces this scientific study of the growth of the mind and body.”Man in the making” series probes the development of the child during the first few years of life.

results.title: Mother and child
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Man in the Making”.
How important is the bond between mother and baby to the future emotional development of the child? Here the latest scientific evidence is examined through experiments with baby rats and monkeys. Experiments on human babies are impossible, but the film shows the effect of depriving babies of mothers or even substitute mothers in cases where this has unfortunately happened. Speakers include: Dr J.A. Ambrose, Dr R.A. Hinde and Dr Seymour Levine.

results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Man in the Making”.
The relationship between animal mothers and their young is built up by a series of complex instinctive responses, and today some scientists see similar kinds of behaviour patterns in human mothers and babies. The first almost automatic smile of a baby may be a simple instinctive action which plays an important part in its development. Children reared in an institution tend to lapse into a state of withdrawal. Speakers include: Dr Mavis Gunther, Dr R.A. Hinde and Dr J.A. Ambrose.

results.title: Perception
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Man in the Making”.
A study of the development of perception in the human being. An experiment to test the reaction of a baby to a cliff is shown. Speakers include Dr. J. M. Tanner, Dr. KM. L. Johnson Abercrombie, and Dr. Kevin Murphy.

results.title: First steps
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Man in the Making”.
This film deals with the development of the brain and the changes brought about as it matures. It attempts to answer such questions as: does a child learn to walk, or is it something that develops regardless of learning?
